Question_1.Context: The study focused on the impact of deficit irrigation and fertilization on chili plants.
Question_1.Question: What was the effect of deficit irrigation on the enzymatic activity of capsaicin synthase (CS) in 'Chili-AS Rot'?
Question_1.D: Varied depending on the irrigation treatment
Question_1.Source: In 'Chili-AS Rot', the deficit irrigation had the highest CS activity of 16.08 nmol/s*g FW compared to the other treatments.

Question_2.Context: The study examined the nitrogen utilization from fertilizer in chili plants.
Question_2.Question: How did the utilization of nitrogen fertilizer change in 'Naga Morich' under deficit irrigation?
Question_2.D: Varied depending on the fertilizer treatment
Question_2.Source: In 'Naga Morich', N yield and percent N utilization of fertilizer were approximately between 55 and 65% lower in the half-fertilizer treatments regardless of irrigation treatment.

Question_3.Context: The study analyzed the impact of deficit irrigation on capsaicinoid content in chili plants.
Question_3.Question: What was the effect of deficit irrigation on the total capsaicinoid content in 'Naga Morich'?
Question_3.D: Varied depending on the irrigation treatment
Question_3.Source: The content of total capsaicinoids was higher in FCff and DIff than in the FCff and FChf.

Question_4.Context: The study investigated the impact of deficit fertilization on chili plant yield.
Question_4.Question: How did the yield of 'Chili-AS Rot' compare between the deficit irrigation and full-fertilization treatment?
Question_4.D: Varied depending on the plant part analyzed
Question_4.Source: The yield of 'Chili-AS Rot' was between 18.2 and 26.7% higher than the other treatments under deficit irrigation.

Question_5.Context: The study examined the effect of deficit irrigation on nitrogen translocation in chili plants.
Question_5.Question: What was the impact of deficit irrigation on nitrogen translocation in 'Chili-AS Rot'?
Question_5.D: Varied depending on the nitrogen content in the plant parts
Question_5.Source: In the cultivar 'Chili-AS Rot', deficit irrigation was found to reduce the utilization of N fertilizer when the plant and fruit were considered.

Question_6.Question: Which treatment showed the highest phenylalanine ammonia lyase (PAL) activity in 'Naga Morich'?
Question_6.Source: In 'Naga Morich', CS activity was highest in FCff treatment and lowest in Diff treatment.

Question_8.A: Higher nitrogen yield under deficit irrigation
Question_8.B: Lower nitrogen yield under deficit irrigation
Question_8.C: No significant difference in nitrogen yield

Question_9.Context: The study analyzed the impact of deficit irrigation on plant biomass yield in chili plants.
Question_9.Question: Which treatment showed the highest fruit dry weight in 'Naga Morich'?
Question_9.Source: The DIhf showed the best results, with an 8.8–25.6% higher yield, 19.1–36.5% higher fruit number per plant and 24.9–27.6% higher fruit DW when compared to the other treatments.

Question_10.Question: What was the effect of deficit fertilization on the capsaicin content in 'Naga Morich'?
